Articles.Content:
Hello!, future pizza delivery kerbals. We are hiring!!

We have a pizza order waiting to be delivered to that airfield situated in a island across the ocean.airfield on the island a few km east of KPC (Kerbal Pizza Center))

As pizza delivery kerbals, you have the option design you own air transport!

RULES:

-----The real challenge

-You must take off from the KPC, deliver the pizza to the island airfield by landing on the runway and decoupling a Rockomax Brand Adapter 02, and back to KPC, landing on the runway.

-There is not enough credit for mechJeb, so manage without it!

-Mods are allowed but as always in a different scoreboard.

-----Alternative challenge

-Jettison the pizza load (a Rockomax Brand Adapter 02) that needs to land safely, and back to KPC where you need to land.

-There is not enough credit for mechJeb, so manage without it!

-Mods are allowed but as always in a different scoreboard.

Required

Screens of takeoff, landing and decoupling the Rockomax Brand Adapter 02, and landing.

In case you jettison the load, screenshots of takeoff, jettison, and landing.

The fastest delivery kerbal gets the job!!

Scoreboard

  1. zarakon - 3:28
  2. edveen - 3:48
  3. Darren9 - 3:43 (modded but awesome video)
  4. Tataffe - 4:31
  5. Ninety-Three - 5:48
  6. bsalis - 5:59
  7. rabidrabbit - 6:34
  8. asdier - 7:24
  9. iamaphazael - 7:22 (Didnt deliver pizza, rocket parts instead) <- Gets the "most kerbaly delivery" prize.
  10. Darren9 - 5:17 Modded

Alternative Challenge Board

  1. asdier - 5:55
  2. asdier - 6:28
  3. localSol - 7.49

Edited May 6, 2013 by RawChicken
"island across the ocean" = airfield on the island a few km east of KPC?
I think it be required we drop off a structural fuelsolodge(the deleviery) that must land without damage. It would make more sence and give an extra challenge.

Are we alowed to use other mods for parts. No cheat-parts or autopilots. Is there also a part for boats in case the plane can't carry the pizza

Edited May 2, 2013 by asdier
Is this space plane or rocket exclusive? I think those should be two different classes. And a fuelsolodge is a bit large for a pizza, how about the round battery?

"island across the ocean" = airfield on the island a few km east of KPC?

Yea! Changed OP to make it clear

Are we alowed to use other mods for parts. No cheat-parts or autopilots. Is there also a part for boats in case the plane can't carry the pizza

Yes, but stock part deliveries will be in another board (updated OP)

I think it be required we drop off a structural fuelsolodge(the deleviery) that must land without damage. It would make more sence and give an extra challenge.

See, you need to land in order to get the money.

Okay, challenge changed a little.

Updated OP so please read again.

This challenge is harder now so attempt at your own risk!

Here is my entry: The pizza pop. The pizza is located in the box on the underside of the plane. The box filled with pizza was decoupled at the other airfield. Here are some pictures http://imgur.com/a/UnLxW. My time was 7.32. Hope for the best.

Edit: made this just before you updated the post its all stock

Now with the new rules an even faster pizza delivery with a bigger pizza content. I present you by ASDIER corp. the pizza pop 2 setting the new pizza speed delivery record of 7:24. The evidence is in the same photo album. Download link for the craft: http://www./?ug1ah9718f38awu

Edited May 2, 2013 by asdier

My little plane couldn't carry the large pizza box so the lads over at the dirt runway only got a small one. You may notice it's not all stock It's normally only twin engine but I had to stick two more on for this.

Edited May 2, 2013 by Darren9

I did an all-stock run, landing at both runways, in 5:43. http://imgur.com/a/1BkV3

The craft, full mision pictures in the album above.

I am really bad with planes, I've never done more than spin out the stock planes and build some ion gliders. So my plane design cribbed pretty heavily from the Aeris 3A. I knew I couldn't land a plane to save my life, so I made a little addition that, ended up saving a lot of time. Rather than lining myself up with the runway and braking, I just coast over the runway and deploy some parachutes. At under 60 m/s, they shouldn't tear anything off, and they'll instantly kill all speed, leaving the plane to float to the runway.

My run wasted about ten seconds taking screenshots at the KSC2, and came back with something like 60% fuel, so emptying out some of that fuel for weight reasons ahead of time could make it faster.

Edited May 2, 2013 by Ninety-Three
Putting craft photo into post.

Is it fair your plane broke apart?

Edited May 2, 2013 by asdier

Is it fair your plane broke apart

The wings tore off, but it could still drive around. Given that the challenge didn't specify a perfect landing, and that Jeb could walk away from it, I feel like it should count. Anyway, I'm trying the flight again with less fuel to see if a lighter plane does it much faster, I should have a proper landing shortly.

You already have a very light plane, i think, with a lot of engine power. Can you upload your craft file so i could give it a try with your plane?? If it's a new record it's on your name.

Edited May 2, 2013 by asdier

Yikes. I had just made a plane this morning that had great speed and was really easy to land, so I retrofitted it with the pizza box and tried it over and over again. The combination of trying to do it fast along with trying to take screenshots along the way just killed me. I finally made a successful delivery, then crashed on return.

The sad demise of the PizzaBoy1:

So I scrapped that design and started from scratch, with a little less engine and a lot less fuel, and suceeded on the first test run, although it was a little bit hairy at times. I present the flight of the PizzaBoy2. All stock. Total round trip: 7:22.

Taking off with our tasty payload:

Coming in for a landing. Forgot to switch to chase mode, so I was wildly swinging the camera around to line it up:

But I managed to get it down. Fortunately as it turns out this thing likes to stay in the air, so I actually had to force the nose down to bring it in. You can also see PizzaBoy1's delivery in the background here:

Stopped

And delivered!

I didn't have a lot of runway left by the time I rolled to a stop, but I managed to get her back into the air

Now where's that cursed runway? (I decided during the course of this mission that we really need waypoint indicators. It would make lining up on the runway SO much easier)

Landed! And just a one dollar tip. Cheapskates!

you landed the wrong thing it should have been the adapterplate in stead of your decoupler Now the pizza isnt there

Edited May 2, 2013 by asdier

Here is my try at the alternative challange: the pizza pop 2 alternate. Here are the pictures http://imgur.com/a/vagJu 6:28 Download link: http://www./?bq95a0ig4jz955a

Edited May 2, 2013 by asdier

you landed the wrong thing it should have been the adapterplate in stead of your decoupler Now the pizza isnt there

Oh, FFS! Well, that ought to teach me a lesson to read things more carefully. Well, I'm not going to go back and spend any more time on this one. OP, if you want me to I'll remove my post to save some space. Let me know
Doesn't matter the decoupler weighs even more

Awesome work!!! Jajajajajaa I cant stop laughing!

As for Ninety-Three,good entry, but yes, the plane must be able to takeoff again, im sure you can re-do it without breaking.

I will update the OP now, keep 'em coming!
Are you gonna post the scoreboard soon?? I'm now working on an even faster design.

Are you gonna post the scoreboard soon?? I'm now working on an even faster design.

OP Updated!

Asdier, here's the file for my parachute-based lander. Everything works off action groups.

I keep tweaking it and trying to make it faster, but it's got three engines on one fuel tank and two empty fuselages, so there's not much more speed to get out of it. Also, because I don't understand how planes work, some flights when I take it back to KSC1, it's going 240 m/s, sometimes 250. Does anyone know what might account for 10 m/s change? I know it's not fuel, but that's all I can control for.

I gave my ship another run, came in a little slower this time (5:48), but with all my bits still attached.

I think I'm going to try a six-engine confgiuration with splitters and see how that works out.
